name: Fall2019_Bootcamp
description: <<<<<<< HEAD # Introduction to HTTP and Asynchronous Programming using Node.js In this assignment we will start to build our UF Directory application. We will use [Node.js](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Node.js) and some of its built in modules to implement a server that provides directory data to clients.  ### What is HTTP? (Make sure to read [this](http://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/http-the-protocol-every-web-developer-must-know-part-1--net-31177)) HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is a **stateless** protocol that allows computers to communicate with each other. We use HTTP to allow our client application (the one users see) to communicate with a server that stores and manipulates data relevant to the user.
